semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Malignant Neoplasm in Pregnant Patient
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > l. Sequencing of neoplasm codes > 3) Malignant neoplasm in a pregnant patient

content.full_text: When a pregnant patient has a malignant neoplasm, a code from subcategory O9A.1-, Malignant neoplasm complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, should be sequenced first, followed by the appropriate code from Chapter 2 to indicate the type of neoplasm. (Evidence: pg no: 37, L32-L36)
content.summary: Special sequencing rules for malignant neoplasms occurring during pregnancy, childbirth, or puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 37, L32-L36)
key_concepts: Pregnancy complication code sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 37, L34-L35)
Specific neoplasm code from Chapter 2 follows (Evidence: pg no: 37, L35-L36)
Applies to pregnancy, childbirth, and puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 37, L34-L35)

detailed_rules.rule_text: A code from subcategory O9A.1- should be sequenced first for malignant neoplasm in pregnant patient (Evidence: pg no: 37, L33-L35)
detailed_rules.explanation: The pregnancy complication aspect takes precedence over the specific neoplasm type in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 37, L33-L35)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Follow with appropriate code from Chapter 2 to indicate the type of neoplasm (Evidence: pg no: 37, L35-L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: The specific neoplasm must still be coded but as a secondary diagnosis to provide complete clinical picture (Evidence: pg no: 37, L35-L36)
common_applications: Specific breast cancer code after O9A.1- code
Specific cervical cancer code after O9A.1- code

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify pregnant patient with malignant neoplasm
Step 2: Assign code from subcategory O9A.1- as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Add appropriate Chapter 2 neoplasm code as secondary diagnosis

code_ranges.description: Malignant neoplasm complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 37, L34-L35)
code_ranges.requirement: Sequenced first for pregnant patients with malignant neoplasms
usage_rules: Always sequenced first in pregnant patients (Evidence: pg no: 37, L34-L35)
Followed by specific Chapter 2 neoplasm code (Evidence: pg no: 37, L35-L36)

code_ranges.description: Malignant neoplasms from Chapter 2 (Evidence: pg no: 37, L35-L36)
code_ranges.requirement: Used as additional code to specify neoplasm type
usage_rules: Sequenced after O9A.1- code (Evidence: pg no: 37, L35-L36)

code_patterns.description: Standard pattern for malignant neoplasm in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L33-L36)
code_patterns.explanation: Pregnancy complication code first, then specific neoplasm

coding_scenarios.scenario: Pregnant patient diagnosed with breast cancer during second trimester
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 32-week pregnant patient with newly diagnosed invasive ductal carcinoma of right breast
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify pregnant patient with malignant neoplasm
Step 2: Assign O9A.12- (malignant neoplasm complicating pregnancy, second trimester)
Step 3: Add C50.911 (malignant neoplasm of unspecified site of right female breast)

correct_coding.sequencing: Pregnancy complication first, then specific neoplasm
correct_coding.rationale: Pregnancy complication takes precedence in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 37, L33-L36)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Breast cancer should not be principal when patient is pregnant
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing neoplasm first instead of pregnancy complication

warnings: Never sequence Chapter 2 neoplasm code first in pregnant patients (Evidence: pg no: 37, L33-L36)
best_practices: Always consider pregnancy status when coding malignant neoplasms (Evidence: pg no: 37, L32-L33)
common_mistakes: Forgetting to use O9A.1- codes for pregnant patients with cancer (Evidence: pg no: 37, L33-L35)
tips: Pregnancy complications always take sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 37, L34-L35)
clinical_context: Applies throughout pregnancy, during childbirth, and in puerperium period
